Means and SDs for calculating z-scores

normative_summaries.Rd

Means and SDs for calculating z-scores

Usage

normative_summaries

Format

A list of lists of tibbles. The entry of the list (named nacc) was created from https://files.alz.washington.edu/documentation/uds3-means.pdf. The second (named updated) was created in an attempt to replicate the former, but with the latest available data. The third (name ravlt_trials) contains numbers of somewhat unknown origin, but is still included for completeness. Each of the two entries contain a list of tibbles. Each list entry correspond to a variable that we can standardize to z-scores. Each list entry holds a tibble organized as follows:

age_group

the age group as follows: <60, 60-69, 70-79, 80-89, >89

edu_group

the education group based on years of education as follows: <13 years, 13-15, 16, >16

SEX

the sex group. "m" = "male", "f" = "female".

n

Number of subjects for which the means and standard deviations are based on.

m

mean for variable in group given by age group (and possible sex and education group)

sd

standard deviation
